job_title: Charity Shop Volunteer in Dudley, England
pros:
Great way to get some experience in retail and learn new skills. 
Friendly staff who are always willing to help colleagues and other customers.
cons: The only one I can really think of is not being paid, but you sign up for that as a volunteer aha.

review_title: Great people, amazing work, quite low pay and bureaucratic
job_title: Senior Programme Manager in London, England
pros: The work is amazing, really interesting, diverse and rewarding. My colleagues were wonderful and so collaborative. Also really supportive if you have a family or dependents
cons: The pay is quite low when compared to other major NGOs. It's a huge organisation and very bureaucratic, it's also always going through change and often restructuring so that can be destabilising

pros: Very committed and rigorous team
cons: Terrible salary, no chances to grow

pros: Positivity, team worker & self motivated
cons: Stay organised, working to deadlines & working alone

pros: There is not much positive to say about my engagement as a consultant for Save the Children. I felt quite isolated in working remotely and it was hard to see impact of my work. My counterpart has answered all my emails on time and seemed overall committed to the process.
cons:
I have now waited for over 4 months to be paid on a short term contract despite fulfilling all requirements and handing in all assignments on time. This is an unacceptable treatment of small contractors and independent consultants who are dependent on their clients to pay on time. 

The HR number in the UK never works and my counterpart in the organisation has shielded me from engaging directly with the Finance Team and thus left me stranded with empty promises such as "I'll follow up" and "You'll get your money soon'.

pros: Getting to work with a wide range of people through volunteering, I especially enjoyed interacting with older members of my community and hearing their stories. Working towards a common goal.
cons: Sometimes as a volunteer you may feel  you're working very hard for an outcome you're unsure about, you have to remember most contributions are towards long term goals. Also, stress of dealing with rude customers in retail - but not being paid to do so! Takes a certain level of determination to be a shop volunteer.

pros: You feel like you are part of a team and the organizational culture is very encouraging. This is particularly helpful for young people starting out their careers. I would recommend this place to work.
cons: Interview process can be a little long because of background and reference checks. They only employ the best so you have to prepare very well for the assessment and interview stages.

pros:
- Saving the lives of children in need
- Giving people without opportunities, hope
- Making and visible difference
cons:
- Working in the rain or snow (winter)
- Late hours fundraising 
- Flexible working hours, i would like to work on weekends, to give more to those in need and also still get paid

pros: Amazing cause. There is plenty of scope to develop ideas but a challenge to get stuff through.
cons: Corporate arrogance. A culture of meetings about meetings. Too many middle managers afraid to sign things off. Parts of organisation moves like a dinosaur.

pros:
Very nice team to work with, everyone is passionate about the work that needs doing. 
A great opportunity to meet nice people and make friends for life.
cons: You need to be very confident and very passionate about what you doing. Have a good understanding of people and their needs.

pros: Accomodating, care about staff, care about issues, great brand, good overseas pay, international opportunities.
cons: Resources are often undeutilized / wasted.

pros: Junior and mid-level staff are fantastic. Really passionate and very interesting people.
cons: Serious quality and performance issue amongst senior staff, especially longer-serving members. Often they are doing jobs they are not qualified for or experienced at, have vague job-titles, don't make decisions and communicate very poorly.

pros: They had lunch time talks about the work of the charity.
cons: A wide spread culture of bullying and intimidation by managers who went about their work unchecked.  In addition to this the ex-Tony Blair mob were always bleating on about how lucky we were to have them and that their huge salaries were a personal sacrifice because they could have been earning more in the city.  Vom!

pros: Best kids charity in the world
cons: As an Unpaid volunteer the jobs' benefits are more  than just monetary.
